content: would never try to convince you to buy something that i didn t truly love mmmaaattteeerrriiiaaalllsss as a small business owner i m always on the lookout for ways to make a difference and support other entrepreneurs that s why i love darn good yarn by choosing to start at love and only practice fair sustainable partnerships darn good yarn is a company that seeks to do good in every aspect of their business their wonderful products are supplied by artisans from all over the world and provide job opportunities to many people specifically women who live in underprivileged communities with all the slave labor and unfair work conditions in our world today it s incredible to be able to support a company that truly cares about the people they work with click here to learn more about their story the yarn that i chose for this project is darn good yarn s worsted weight merino wool yarn in the colorway yummy the colors - pink green purple and blue - flow together in such a fun and beautiful way and the softness and squishiness of this single-ply merino will absolutely change your life each delicious skein is handcrafted and hand-dyed by a small family business located in uruguay and i love that i can help make a difference when i buy their work approx 170 yards of dk or worsted weight yarn again i used darn good yarn s worsted weight merino wool in the colorway yummy and i highly recommend it us size 8 5mm 16 circular knitting needles us size 8 5mm dpns optional stitch marker optional yarn needle scissors mmmeeeaaasssuuurrreeemmmeeennntttsss /// gggaaauuugggeee measures approx 19 around at the brim x 8 75 tall 20 st x 40 rounds = 4 in mock honeycomb stitch aaabbbbbbrrreeevvviiiaaatttiiiooonnnsss st s stitch es k knit p purl sl slip kbl knit through back loop wyif with yarn in front s1k2p slip 1 purlwise knit the next 2 sts together pass the slipped st over the k2tog iiinnnssstttrrruuuccctttiiiooonnnsss cast on 96 sts i used the long tail cast on and join to work in the round place stitch marker here if desired to form the brim work kbl1 p1 around for 8 rounds round 1 and all other odd rounds knit around rounds 2 & 4 *sl3 purlwise wyif photo a k1 photo b repeat from * around a b round 6 k1 *insert needle under both strands from the previous rounds and knit the next st making sure to pull through all three loops photos c & d k3 repeat from * around end k2 c d round 8 & 10 k2 *sl3 purlwise wyif k1 repeat from * around note the final st of the last sl3 will include one from the k2 from the beginning of this round round 12 *k3 insert needle under the strands from the previous rounds and knit the next st making sure to pull through all three loops repeat from * around repeat
